org.jtrim.image

Class ImageResult

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jtrim.image.ImageResult
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.jtrim.cache.MemoryHeavyObject

    public final class ImageResult
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.jtrim.cache.MemoryHeavyObject
    Defines an image which was retrieved from an external source. Apart from the image itself, the ImageResult contains the meta data information of the image.

    Although it is possible to mutate the properties of an ImageResult instance, the intended use of ImageResult is to use it as an effectively immutable object. That is, its properties should not be modified (e.g.: The pixels of the BufferedImage should not be modified).

    This class implements the MemoryHeavyObject interface and approximates the size of an ImageResult instance by the approximate size of the underlying BufferedImage.

    Thread safety

    Methods of this class can be safely accessed by multiple threads. Although individual properties are not immutable, they should treated so. Users of this class can assume that the properties of ImageResult are not modified and can be safely accessed by multiple concurrent threads as well.

    Synchronization transparency

    The methods of this class are synchronization transparent.

      ImageResult(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image, ImageMetaData metaData)
      Initializes the ImageResult with the given image and its meta data.

      Returns the height of the image or -1 if it is unknown.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ImageResult

        public ImageResult(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image,
           ImageMetaData metaData)
        Initializes the ImageResult with the given image and its meta data.
        Parameters:
        image - the retrieved image. This argument can be null if no image could be retrieved (maybe because it is not (yet) available.
        metaData - the meta data information about the specified image. If both the meta data and the image is specified (i.e.: not null), the meta data must define the same dimensions for the image as the image itself. This argument can be null if no meta data information is available.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown if both the image and the meta data is specified and they define different dimensions for the image.

    • Method Detail

      • getImage

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage()
        Returns the retrieved image. The image might be incomplete or partial if not completely available or in case of some failure.
        Returns:
        the retrieved image. This method may return null, if null was specified at construction time.

      • getMetaData

        public ImageMetaData getMetaData()
        Returns the meta data information of the image. In case both the meta data and the image are specified, they define the same dimensions. That is, both getMetaData().getWidth() == getImage().getWidth() and getMetaData().getHeight() == getImage().getHeight() holds.
        Returns:
        the meta data information of the image. This method may return null, if null was specified at construction time.

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Returns the width of the image or -1 if it is unknown.

        If the meta data is available, the width is retrieved from the meta data, if not and the image is available, it is retrieved from the image.

        Returns:
        the width of the image or -1 if it is unknown

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Returns the height of the image or -1 if it is unknown.

        If the meta data is available, the height is retrieved from the meta data, if not and the image is available, it is retrieved from the image.

        Returns:
        the height of the image or -1 if it is unknown

      • getApproxMemorySize

        public long getApproxMemorySize()
        Returns the approximate size of memory in bytes, the image of this ImageResult retains. That is, this method returns the same value as the ImageData.getApproxSize(getImage()) invocation.
        Specified by:
        getApproxMemorySize in interface org.jtrim.cache.MemoryHeavyObject
        Returns:
        the approximate size of memory in bytes, the image of this ImageResult retains. This method always returns a value greater than or equal to zero.
